channel.title: Server help.. got it all but
channel.description:
Problem: Getting others to join it. Meaning it won't go up, only localhost works
I have made my no-ip, i portforwarded, I did it all.
Basically, here's what the issue is:
I compile my server, then run it. Typing in the IP, it does not work, but typing in localhost, it works. As you read above, no-ip IS set up, and portwarding is done.
My thoughts:
Well, I was thinking about it and it looks like my no-ip has nothing to do with the server. Meaning it is not connected anyway, so it won't work. I really don't know what the issue is, but I know it has somthing to do with the no-ip and/or portforwarding. They are not connected any how, and when I make the IPs both the same, it STILL does not work..
Any takers?

item.title: Server help.. got it all but
item.dc:creator: @erko321 erko321
item.description:
@erko321 wrote:

or have it set to DMZ option correct me if i made a mistake in it
but that opens up all ports settings firewall w/e for any1 if your running game sevrers its a good idea to use that and have some good anti viruse just incase

Read full topic
item.source: Server help.. got it all but

item.title: Server help.. got it all but
item.dc:creator: @Sinior_Jube_Head Sinior Jube Head
item.description:
@Sinior_Jube_Head wrote:

OK, what he means by firewall, is, on your router, there SHOULD be some sort of ‘firewall rules’ area where you change your firewall rules and such… lol. in this area , you need to add your ‘service’ as it is called on some to the ‘firewall rules’ so the port you set and the ip to ur router, e.t.c, is allowed to be sent in ‘inbound’ and ‘outbound’ traffic. Just try and find somethign to do with ‘firewall’ in your router setup page. After doign this, people including yourself should be able to access your server because the firewall is letting peoples computers IN to find the info, and letting the info OUT so people can use the info. a.k.a. connect to your port and IP.

[center] ~ Sinior Jube Head[/center]

Read full topic
item.source: Server help.. got it all but

item.title: Server help.. got it all but
item.dc:creator: @erko321 erko321
item.description:
@erko321 wrote:

he might have i use to have same problem with my old router i couild my router company and they told me it may not be able to be bypassed depending on service protection and i couldnt either that or he didnt allow his firewall to accept incoming connections on that port

Read full topic

item.title: Server help.. got it all but
item.dc:creator: @Fun_4_me_not_u Fun 4 me not u
item.description:
@Fun_4_me_not_u wrote:

I use a Dynex DX-E402 btw[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 05, 2008, 08:53:46 PM[/size][hr]Skiller, what do you mean?

I’ve tried to disable my windows firewall, that didn’t work. Then, i added an execption to it, and that didn’t work.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 05, 2008, 09:26:20 PM[/size][hr]FFS lol…

I still don’t understand why, and I’m guessing a lot of others don’t either that’s why no responses.

If anyone wants to take a look, they can use remote assistant. just PM me

Read full topic

item.title: Server help.. got it all but
item.dc:creator: @Fun_4_me_not_u Fun 4 me not u
item.description:
@Fun_4_me_not_u wrote:

Yeah, but I followed portforward.com and all.

Service Port: 43594 (XX-XX or XX)
IP Address: MY IP HERE
Protocol: ALL
Status: Enabled

Common Service Port: --Select One–

Where it says IP address, I put the one that my no-ip downloaded thing says.

Read full topic
